mads:mads.mads:note: His Palliatae [CF] 1991: PHI CD Rom #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (Licinius Imbrex)
Pauly-Wissowa: 25, Halbbd., col. 371; "Licinius", #92 (Licinius Imbrex; according to Gellius, an "old writer of comedies"; possibly contemporary with Plautus)
Oxford class. dict., 1st ed.: p. 504 (Licinius Imbrex; Latin poet

Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol 2, 1867, p. 571: "Imbrex, C. Licinius, an ancient Latin comic poet, quoted by Gellius and Festus, of whose plays only one is expressly mentioned, namely, "Neara"...."

Brill's New Pauly: "L. Imbrex Probably a poet of comedies, 2nd cent. BC, ... Probably a contemporary of Plautus (vetus comoediarum scriptor, Gell. NA 13,23,16; Festus Paulus p. 109 M.); Volcacius Sedigitus ....ranked him fourth after Caecilius [III 6], Plautus and Naevius in the canon of Roman comedians. He wrote comedies, of which only the Neaera (CRF 39) is known; the same comedy title is already mentioned in Timocles and Philemon..." from Blänsdorf, Jürgen (Mainz). "Licinius." Brill's New Pauly. Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and ; Helmuth Schneider . Brill, 2011. Brill Online. Tufts University Library. 16 March 2011
